taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Seems to be associated with streams and rivers with clear water, moderate to fast current and a gravel to stony bottom (Ref. 27732).  Found near the bottom in pools of small to medium-sized rivers.  Typically occurs near decaying plant debris where it feeds on insects and other invertebrates.  Possibly moves out into flooded forests during high-water periods.  Apparently found in localized populations and encountered sporadically (Ref. 12693).  Reported as a nocturnal species by villagers in Ban Pakphanang (Laos), where all specimens were obtained at night (Ref. 27732).  Rare in markets (Ref. 12693).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.references: Kottelat, M. 1998 Fishes of the Nam Theun and Xe Bangfai basins, Laos, with diagnoses of twenty-two new species (Teleostei: Cyprinidae, Balitoridae, Cobitidae, Coiidae and Odontobutidae). Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 9(1):1-128. (Ref. 27732)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Last simple dorsal ray feebly serrated posteriorly; a large black apical blotch on the dorsal fin; a bright red caudal fin without black lobe tips when live (Ref. 27732).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#TrophicStrategy
dataObjects.description: Occurs near the bottom in pools of small to medium sized rivers. Found near decaying plant debris. Moves out into flooded forests during high water periods. (Ref. 12693).
